results.title: Art attack 2
results.creator_credit: Nick Bigsby, Neil Buchanan, Tim Edmunds, Television South and Media Merchants
results.brief_description: Learn how to be creative with art - techniques which seem complex are explained simply and with great illustration. Be creative in a fun way, using cheap, everyday objects. In this episode topics covered include cartooning - learn how to draw animal caricatures and different cartoon bodies, and splash out with splash art - learn how to brighten up dull clothes.

results.title: Art attack
results.creator_credit: Nick Bigsby, Neil Buchanan, Tim Edmunds, Television South and Media Merchants
results.brief_description: Learn how to be creative with art - techniques which seem complex are explained simply and with great illustration - be creative in a fun way, using cheap, everyday objects. In this episode you can learn how to make a pastry face mask, create your very own ancient treasure map, and design a poster out of your name.

results.title: Arrows against the wind
results.creator_credit: Tracey Groome, SBS-TV and A Land Beyond Production
results.brief_description: Describes the culture and traditional way of life of the indigenous peoples of West Papua (Irian Jaya), and the social, political and environmental upheaval they have endured since the beginning of Indonesian rule in 1963. Outlines their continuing struggle for social justice and self-determination.

results.title: Around the world in search of steam: the life & travels of Colin Garrett
results.brief_description: Colin Garratt is engaged in a lifetime crusade to photograph and record the end of the age of steam around the world. Colin and his assistant Sarah King begin in Spain, in search of a Manchester built Sharp Stewart 0-6-OT; then on to Turkey and the last of the famous Stanier 8F’s, the Isle of Man and China, making noteworthy and entertaining discoveries on the way. Reflecting on the photographs, Colin and Sarah have compiled a body or work that is a testament to the importance of steam driven power across the ages.

results.title: Around the clock
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Kestrel Films & Video (Australia) and Department of Postmaster-General
results.brief_description: There are approximately 5,500 official and unofficial post offices under the auspices of Australia Post. The film shows various aspects of the work done by Australia Post, moving mail by land, air, and sea. No credits available.

results.title: Around a gum tree
results.creator_credit: Owen Brothers Animated Films, David Bilcock, Geoffrey Bell and Shell Oil Company
results.brief_description: Shows examples of Australia’s many varieties of gum trees growing in their natural surroundings. The way people live in the different types of country is described in addition to the main story of the gum trees themselves.

results.title: Arab identity: who are the Arabs? (Episode 1)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Thomas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Contrasts the diversity of one hundred and twenty-five million Arabs and the unifying power of their heritage. Shows the force of the Islamic faith as pilgrims throng to Mecca’s Great Mosque. Shows that four hundred miles to the North, Arab traditions are dying under political and Western influence.

results.title: Approximately panther
results.creator_credit: Peter Lamb and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Douglas Panther reports on the teenage cults of today. The swing from America to Britain as the current trend-setter in fashion and pop music, originating with The Beatles, is evident. Introduces Australian personalities, Lyn Randell, The Loved Ones, and Normie Rowe who have made the international Scene. Shows several discotheques and comments on the entertainment they offer.

results.title: Ark of Gondwana: Victoria's rainforest heritage
results.creator_credit: Brendan Lavelle, Marion Crooke and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Rainforests are among the Earth’s most ancient and diverse natural communities. They are very fragile habitats. In Victoria, rainforests are limited to scattered patches because of previous climatic conditions and the impact of European settlement. The video examines the rainforest theme in three segments: The Living Ark: looks at the ancient link between Australia’s rainforests and those in other parts of the world and gives an introduction to life in a rainforest. Rainforest Odyssey: examines the types of rainforest in Victoria and their distribution. A Fragile Heritage: looks at the importance of Victoria’s rainforests and factors that threaten their survival.

results.title: Are we winning mommy?: America and the cold war
results.creator_credit: Barbara Margolis, Sveriges TV, National Film Board of Canada, Channel 4 and Cine Information
results.brief_description: An award-winning documentary that explores the historical roots of the Cold War and its effects on American life. Featuring historical footage from European and American archives and revealing interviews with key players from both sides, the film traces the Cold War from the end of World War II to the period of Reagan’s Star Wars proposal. It was a war created from ideas, fears and actions of specific people, with real casualties in compromised ideals, economic opportunities and peoples lives. Includes an extensive sampling of Cold War images from Hollywood feature films, TV shows and animated cartoons. Suitable for upper-secondary and tertiary level education.
